document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan Ž. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.masterDocTitle: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

heading.emphasis:
Heterocaucaseuma feminaepectorum
gen. et sp. nov.

Posterior gonopods, posterior view. a = apex; c = coxite; o = opening; s = medial part; t = telopodite; cp = coxal process; cv = coxal vesicle; d 1 and d 2 = subtriangular denticles; gs = group of setae; lo = lobe; lp = lateral part; ls = lamellar structure; rs = row of setae; sh 1 and sh 2 = shoulders of medial part; ss = sternal sac.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Differs from the other
Heterocaucaseuma
gen. nov.
species by the presence of almost equally high lateral horns and medial syncoxal part of the anterior gonopods. The medial part is with a pair of anterior lobes and two pairs of lateral shoulders. The coxal process on male leg-pair 7 is long, knife-like. Male leg-pair 10 with an apical, posteroventral, nippled process.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 56.
Heterocaucaseuma feminaepectorum
gen. et sp. nov. , male from Cave Osennyaya, Alek Mt. Range, near Sochi, Krasnodar Province, Russia, habitus. Scale line = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. To empasize the presence of a pair of lobes in the medial part of the anterior gonopods which resemble the human female breast.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
RUSSIA : Krasnodar Province, Sochi , karst massif of Mt Dzykhra ,
835 m
asl, Cave Krasnoyarskaya.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body with 30 segments (including telson) in adults.
Measurements. Males 19–27 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 1.6–2 mm . Females 21.5– 27.5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 1.8–1.9 mm .

HEAD . Convex. Labrum ( paratype male) with three medial teeth and 4+5 labral and 2+2 supralabral setae. Promentum triangular, without setae. Lingual plates ( paratype male) with 19+19 setae. Stipites with ca 50+50 setae, numerous microsetae. Antennae long and slender, 4.07 mm long in paratype male. Length of antennomeres (in mm): I (0.17), II (0.41), III (1.12), IV (0.6), V (1.1), VI (0.4), VII (0.25) and VIII (0.03). Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I–VII: I (1), II (2), III (7.5), IV (4), V (7.5), VI (2.5) and VII (2). Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum, respectively. Number of ocelli 10–16, arranged in 3–4 rows in males; 12–18 in 4 rows in females.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 57.
Heterocaucaseuma feminaepectorum
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male. A. Pleurotergites 14 and 15, posterior view. B. Pleurotergites 14 and 15, lateral view. C. Prozonite of pleurotergite 14, dorsal view. D. Lateral keel of prozonite 14, dorsal view. E. Pleurotergite 14, dorsal view.

FIGURE 58.
Heterocaucaseuma feminaepectorum
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male. A. Leg 3. B. Leg 4. C. Leg 7. D. Leg 10. Scale lines = 0.4 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: COLLUM. Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior edge semi-circular, posterior margin gently concave.

BODY SEGMENTS ( Figs 56 , 57 ). Lateral keels well-developed. Macrochaetae relatively long and trichoid. CIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.65; MIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 1.2; PIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.65; MA (pleurotergite 15) ~ 110˚.
TELSON. Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and 3+3 setae (1+1 paramedian, 2+2 marginal). Hypoproct with 1+1 apical setae. Paraprocts with 3+3 marginal setae.
WALKING LEGS ( Fig. 56 ). In both sexes, leg-pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae; femora and postfemora with a group of several long and robust setae.

MALE SEXUAL CHARACTERS ( Fig. 58 ). Leg-pairs 3–7 enlarged. Leg-pairs 3 and 4 each with a basal exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 5 with a well-developed, oral, basal protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 6 without peculiarities. Leg-pair 7 with a posterior, knife-like, coxal process, this being well-developed, orientated mesad. Leg-pair 10 with coxal glands and an apical, posteroventral, nippled process. Leg-pair 11 with coxal glands, no other peculiarities.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 60.
Heterocaucaseuma feminaepectorum
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male gonopods. A. Anterior gonopods, anterior view. B. and C. Anterior gonopods, anterolateral view. D. Anterior gonopods, lateral view. E. Anterior gonopods, posterodistal view. F. Anterior gonopods detail, posterior view. G. Anterior gonopods, anterodistal view. H. Posterior gonopods, posterior view. a = apex; c = coxite; o = opening; s = medial part; t = telopodite; cp = coxal process; cv = coxal vesicle; d1 and d2 = subtriangular denticles; gs = group of setae; lo = lobe; lp = lateral part; ls = lamellar structure; rs = row of setae; sh1 and sh2 = shoulders of medial part; ss = sternal sac.

subSubSection.paragraph: POSTERIOR GONOPODS ( Figs 59 D, 60H). Coxites ( c ) [= cx sensu Golovatch and Makarov (2011) : 19, fig 43] divided. Laterally and posteriorly, telopodital remnants ( t ) [= te sensu Golovatch and Makarov (2011) : 19, fig 43] and a pigmented mass present. Coxal vesicles ( cv ) [= k sensu Golovatch and Makarov (2011) : 19, fig 43] present anteriorly. Each coxite bearing a pair of flagelliform coxal processes ( cp ) [= pr sensu Golovatch and Makarov (2011) : 19, fig 43].
Distribution. Russia (known only from a few caves near Sochi) ( Fig. 167 , blue circle).
Note. With some troglomorphic features, such as reduced body pigmentation, somewhat elongated walking legs and antennae and a larger number of setae on the gnathochilarium.
